'''Napster, Inc.''' is an [[Online music store|online music service]] offering a variety of purchase and subscription models. The company's name and logo originated from bankruptcy liquidation of the [[Napster]] [[peer-to-peer]] file trading service,<ref>{{cite news | title=Porno company offers to buy Napster | date=[[September 12]], [[2002]] | publisher=CNET News.com | url=http://news.com.com/2100-1023-957784.html?tag=fd_top}}</ref> which was shut down after a series of legal actions taken by the [[RIAA]]. The brand name was later purchased by Roxio, to capitalize on the popularity of the former service. The service currently has a music catalogue of over 8,000,000 songs, making it one of the largest online music stores. Napster, Inc. was purchased by Best Buy.
+
'''Napster, Inc.''' is an [[Online music store|online music service]] offering a variety of purchase and subscription models. The company's name and logo originated from bankruptcy liquidation of the [[Napster]] [[peer-to-peer]] file trading service,<ref>{{cite news | title=Porno company offers to buy Napster | date=[[September 12]], [[2002]] | publisher=CNET News.com | url=http://news.com.com/2100-1023-957784.html?tag=fd_top}}</ref> which was shut down after a series of legal actions taken by the [[RIAA]]. The brand name was later purchased by [[Roxio]], to capitalize on the popularity of the former service. The service currently has a music catalogue of over 8,000,000 songs, making it one of the largest online music stores. Napster, Inc. was purchased by [[Best Buy]].
